Description: Sherd of East Greek, possibly Clazomenian, black-figured pottery lid with large flange; pale slip; glaze differentially fired; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of confronting felines, possibly lions (only part of mane and forelegs of one feline, to right; one foreleg of second feline, to left); below, two narrow black bands; wide black band on flat rim.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.063) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
